title: TIA and start-up companies

author: Mojca Skalar Komljanc, Public Agency for Technology of the Republic of Slovenia

segmentation: So my name is Martha Scholar come landside, coming from technology agencies.
Thank you Spiller for inviting me here to greet you all and to congratulate, congratulate to all of you young researchers who are here today to represent your projects.
I was asked to shortly present you the possibilities that technology agency is offering in the meaning of financing the startups in Slovenia.
So.
So, um, start the supports various companies through various programs.
One of the program I'm running is in on.
You know it's vendor that offers grants to support the.
Innovative.

Environment for the companies for the young companies and startups, and it's of course also supports also the events like this one today, so I'm happy to announce that we are actually financing this event here.
And so we are sure, and we want this environment to become supportive to all young, innovative companies that are trying to succeed not only in Slovenia but also around the world.
Because we know that Slovenia is the small company.
So if we want to be successful, we want to go out.
So we're actually trying to create supportive, innovative environment for all.
Young startups here.
And another program is Vellore.
Here are also my colleagues are trying to be to also mentor the projects that were actually supported through this program.
This program was just closed now and we supported 6 new companies.
6 new startups.
I think one of the representatives here also today.
So if he cannot offer you probably his.
Knowledge about it and his experiences, so I would just like to invite you young companies because the standards are actually issued every year and will be also issue next year too.
The comment to try to get this this is actually for startups.
The money is meant to develop the first prototype of your idea, so you're all invited to come and present your projects.
I think the this was really also one of the best projects last year.
Alot of companies also succeeded.
I really don't have no information which of them was because my colleague is running to standard.
But for any information, you can always come to our agency and we will give you everything we have.
So like I said before, both of these mentioned management standards will be issued net issue next year too, so you are invited to participate an I hope to get some support from our agency too.
So if you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us.
We are there to help you.
Also with the mentoring not only with the money in the tender before in the in our supporting there are a lot of companies that were support through Tia to help young companies.
So you also have a list of those who got the money from US to support you with.
Also the not quite a voucher system, but they're actually also financing you the patenting.
And try to help sort out the questions you have.
With the innovating new product.
So for any further information, I would be happy if you contact us.
This is our address, our email and.
Anything else, maybe spell I will help you with further information if you need.
Thank you very much.
Paul, yes.
Love life.
Why not becausw?
As my knowledge, I think that it was not possible for University spinoff to apply for this public call because there was some criteria which was that the the.
Company should not bother OK?
Is not allowed to have the.
Public public part.
In it, yes, well, I don't think the spin of this meant to be like a public part.
It's really mental to create a spinoff company from the University, but there has to be a contract between University and spinoff company.
Then you come I will have to interrupt this discussion.
I mean, I already did.
But that's that's a discussion that should be carried out in front of our policy makers, because it's a policy problem.

It's a matter of what is allowed in sleeping and what is not allowed, and T is playing according to the rules, which are not what would be possibly the best things for the universities and the public research organizations.
But I I suggest we continue this discussion later.
It's a very important one, but I really think we should now give the word 2.
Our applicants into our Commission.
Thank you, Martin, thank you.
